Putting it all together.

Now, handling the dynamic allocation for mod_arr. Also, need to free it after use, but since it's a single run, it's okay.

Now, code outline:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main() {
    char S[100005]; // assuming max input length is manageable, like 1e5
    fgets(S, sizeof(S), stdin);
    // Remove newline character if present
    size_t len = strlen(S);
    if (len > 0 && S[len-1] == '\n') {
        S[len-1] = '\0';
        len--;
    }
    int N = len;
    int *mod_arr = malloc(N * sizeof(int));
    if (!mod_arr) {
        // handle error, but for code submission, assume it works
    }
    int mod_cnt[2019] = {0};
    int radix = 1;
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        char c = S[N-1 -i];
        int digit = c - '0';
        int tmp = (digit * radix) % 2019;
        if (i != 0) {
            tmp = (tmp + mod_arr[i-1]) % 2019;
        }
        mod_arr[i] = tmp;
        mod_cnt[tmp]++;
        radix = (radix * 10) % 2019;
    }
    mod_cnt[0]++;
    long long ans = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < 2019; i++) {
        ans += (long long) mod_cnt[i] * (mod_cnt[i] -1) / 2;
    }
    free(mod_arr);
    // Now process the second program's part
    char ans_str[25]; // enough for 20 digits plus null
    sprintf(ans_str, "%lld", ans);
    // Replace commas with spaces
    for (int i = 0; ans_str[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        if (ans_str[i] == ',') {
            ans_str[i] = ' ';
        }
    }
    printf("%s\n", ans_str);
    return 0;
}
